clues.text: "Le's do it now. Le's get that place now" were Lennie's last words to George in this Steinbeck novella
In chapter 1 of this novel, the narrator says, "People are always asking, did I know about Tyler Durden"
Popular books of the '40s included this novel about a girl & her family living in a tough part of NYC's Williamsburg area
1969's "The House on the Strand" was one of the last novels by this "Rebecca" author
Maxine Hong Kingston said of this 1931 classic, which she read in 9th grade, "it humanized Chinese people"
Weather-sounding process to develop creative ideas through free thinking & collaboration
Adjective for the parts of a proposed deal that are not open to discussion or modification
Specific profession of filmmaker Errol Morris
A prisoner held this way is not allowed any contact with the outside world
Uncapitalized, it can mean "containing coal"; capitalized, it's a geological period of many vast swamps
"Queen Charlotte" by Julia Quinn & Shonda Rhimes is a novel prequel to events in this Netflix series
Buzzy on BookTok, this work about a hockey player & a figure skater is fittingly titled for a joke that relieves initial tensions
Robinne Lee wrote this novel about a 39-year-old who falls for a boy band singer; it's now a film with Anne Hathaway
Known for another series with Anastasia Steele, this author began her "Mister & Missus" series in 2019
Fans of this bestselling author of "Slammed" & "Point of Retreat" are known as CoHorts
A right cross or jab on Oahu
This type of motor engine has an octet of cylinders
It's another term for an elf or a pixie
No booze in Ontario or Winnipeg?

rounds.comments: (Ken: These are words that closely follow the word "all" in the dictionary.)

clues.text: Torta Caprese is a traditional Italian cake made with chocolate & these nuts
This 2-word phrase refers to the university you went to or the anthem sung there
Synonyms for this word of indifference include standoffish & distant
Someone who loses a political race is deemed one of these hyphenated finishers, a term borrowed from horse racing
In an airplane, this portmanteau device can help determine when you're losing or gaining elevation
Baylor claims the title of oldest continuously operating university in this state
During WWII this New England school ran the Radiation Lab, the nation's leading center for radar development
Creator of "The Sex Lives of College Girls", Mindy Kaling loved shooting in "beautiful" Poughkeepsie at this college
In 1853 T.S. Eliot's grandfather led the founding of Washington University in this city
Before spreading joy around New England, Bill Belichick played tight end at this religious-named school in Middletown, Conn.
Many stubby little everyday words are from Anglo-Saxon, but Greek pyxos gave us this, meaning a container or to fight with fists
In the early 1900s the makers of a new vacuum flask with a metal casing held a competition to name it & this won
Greek for "art" originated part of the name of this process that made movies like "Gone with the Wind" glow
When Oedipus vows to find his father's killer, who in fact is himself, that's the situational type of this word
Anthony Burgess wrote, "The words slide into the slots ordained by" this, the set of rules for constructing sentences
He wrote a sequel, "Paradise Regained", published 4 years after "Paradise Lost"
Due to obscenity charges, this last D.H. Lawrence novel wasn't published in full in London until 1960
The title of this Ian Fleming story for kids about a magical car may have been inspired by the name of an Eton schoolmaster
Matthew Arnold wrote the poem "Calais Sands" before his more famous one about this "Beach" across the Channel
In the first chapter of this E.M. Forster book, Lucy comments, "I want so to see the Arno"
2 of Rihanna's 14 No. 1 hits, "What's My Name?" & "Work", featured this Canadian rapper
Billboard called this Australian singer's "Somebody Like You" the No. 1 country song of the first decade of the 21st century
Robert Van Winkle is the real name of this rapper who was "cool" in the early 1990s
He topped the charts in 1976 duetting with Kiki Dee on "Don't Go Breaking My Heart"

Before it was annexed by the U.S. in 1845, it claimed a panhandle that extended up into Wyoming
In 1974 the U.S. repealed a Depression-era ban on private ownership of this that had been meant to prevent hoarding
In 1899, New York City newsboys went on strike, refusing to distribute papers published by Joseph Pulitzer & this rival magnate
A December 2, 1954 resolution said the conduct of this man "is contrary to senatorial traditions and is hereby condemned"

Lewis & Clark wintered near it in 1805-1806:
CUBA LIMO
Meaning "great river", it's part of the geography of 6 African countries: MAZE BIZ
Mandalay & Magwe are port cities on it: DRAW DIARY

It begins at the western end of Great Slave Lake:
ECZEMA INK

Down south, some of the flow of the Mississippi is diverted into it:
AHA CALF AT YA

rounds.text: Name shared by a groundbreaking magazine launched in April 1926 & a TV anthology series that premiered in September 1985
